DataElement.preferredName: Obesity Dietary Screener Questionnaire Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more)._Regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person or animal. This does not include DIET THERAPY, a specific diet prescribed in the treatment of a disease._A questionnaire designed to identify a condition in the responding individual._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).:The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health._A questionnaire designed to identify a condition in the responding individual.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).

Property.preferredDefinition: Regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person or animal. This does not include DIET THERAPY, a specific diet prescribed in the treatment of a disease.:No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: The customary allowance of food and drink taken by a person or an animal from day to day, particularly one especially planned to meet specific requirements of the individual, including or excluding certain items of food; a prescribed course of eating and drinking in which the amount and kind of food, as well as the times at which it is to be taken, are regulated for therapeutic purposes or selected with reference to a particular state of health.
A questionnaire designed to identify a condition in the responding individual.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
